content:
We're about to print our logo on a million different things (stickers, banners, etc), so if you're inclined it'd be great to spend a few minutes thinking if you have any creative ideas (or non-creative ideas) for how the current logo could be improved.

I think we want something that's

  • warm and friendly
  • ideally also feels cool or creative
  • not developer-centric

Sketches or half-baked ideas are totally fine.

I think there is a disconnect between the different ideas about the logo...

  • Zulip suggest 'tulip' but never considered a tulip for logo?!?
  • the logo does not have to be a Z (obvious, but maybe has to be said explicitly)
  • Greenish is not 'warm' nor it is flowery (the disconnect)
  • Octopus seems to be the 'trend' nowadays - I saw a collection of 404 pages, and 5 of them had octopi!
    TL;DR A tulip is not green, nor it is an octopus :D

I think the rhyme with tulip, although not completely coincidental, is something that we've never really pursued. I'm not sure a flowery theme makes sense for us, unless there's some metaphor I'm missing.
If we want an alternative for the octopus, we could go with the roots of a tulip. That would offer similar design options as with the arms of a squid and be something non-standard.
Well, a tulip is warm, unlike cold colors like green and blue. It is also very consistent with the actual name.

There are at least three goals a logo/brand has to achieve:

  • convey meaning and values of the brand
  • be as different from other competitors as possible (for differentiation)
  • consistently represent that idea

pasted image
Something like this, maybe with the flower head of a tulip in the middle. the roots could represent the users all communicating with the "center zulip".
https://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/flower-roots-6769647.jpg
I would say more like this?
Yup, definitely!
But that might be more of a high-level concept. The actual logo needs to be very very simple in shape.
https://www.google.bg/search?q=tulip+logo&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiz2oL3vLjTAhULDcAKHTOaBEgQ_AUICCgB&biw=959&bih=681
If somehow we can add the concept of chat or connecting people to the simple shape of a tulip, that might be a 10x stronger logo than any variation of the letter Z
The problem with roots is that it will make people think of dirt. As much as humans rely on soil, I don't think dirt is great for a brand.

Here are my concrete suggestions:

  • Adopt a very stylized Tulip as logo/mascot - consistent with name
  • Have a warm purple hue for color - benefit is that it differs than most apps
  • Use the flower + roots more in a 'hero image' role, not as the logo - it can suggest that when people come together (the roots) beautiful things happen (the flower)

I'll continue to push back on tulip ideas, because I think that flowers don't really fit our brand. Flowers have a very strong cultural connotation for romance, apologies, and condolences. They're also ephemeral and fragile, whereas Zulip aims to be permanent and sturdy.
What about a cactus then?
The thing is, the name is Zulip, not Zactus, nor Zermanent or Zturdy :)

I don't think a tulip is ideal, but also consistency is way more important, because you can add meaning to a good symbol. One of the most popular chat-like app has a bird for a logo (Twitter) and the biggest computer/mobile company has a fruit.
Also ideally, it is not about permanent or sturdy, but about teams and connections. But it is even harder to show this with a simple logo.
Our current theme is aquatic, which implies an ecosystem (fish, octupi, etc.) and an essential resource (water). I agree that the name doesn't really suggest the theme.

So I created a list of some possible mascots, which could server as logo ideas that fit with the aquatic theme.

  • animals with toolish arms

    • crab
    • jellyfish
    • octopus
    • starfish

  • plants

    • lotus flower (tulip-like, but fits the aquatic theme)

  • other

    • mechanical animals (e.g. mechanical octopus)
I personally think the octopus is a great choice of animal because it reflects something about what one can do with Zulip -- manage and participate in many conversations at the same time.
there's a sea tulip https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_tulip
@Tim Abbott then double down on the octopus? Zulip, the zoctopus? Make the logo an octopus, make the colors and theming more 'sea-like'?
A sea tulip will be the most obscure reference ever ;)
I'm all for the octopus as well!

After reading all the discussions related to Zulip's branding and image, I was wondering whether we could benefit of some ultra-minimalistic logo design, especially taking into account that's what we've been moving towards in the latest UI changes (which, by the way, I love).
Something like this, maybe? (super quick mockup)
A logo/brand by definition has to to be distinctive. You can't go for a letter and then be super-simple - that results in generic graphics, which is the opposite of distinctive.
'z in a circle' is so boring and meaningless that there are hundreds of similar graphics on the internet if you google it :D

If Zulip is to be about an octopus, then at least more consistency about this idea - the color should either be blue, or 'octopus color' whatever it is. And the icon should be a whole octopus or part of an octopus or something.
That makes a lot of sense. Thanks for the explanation! :)
In fact it is super-important to have a distinctive logo. It trumps a logo being pretty. In that regard it turns out Steve Jobs' Next's logo is rather good (I still remember it vividly)
http://www.logodesignlove.com/images/classic/next-logo-paul-rand.jpg

For anyone that likes logo design, here is analysis of all Olymic Logos from a design legend:
https://eyeondesign.aiga.org/milton-glaser-analyzes-olympic-logo-design-through-the-ages/
Octopus tentacles are fairly iconic, and could lend themselves to a slightly fanciful Z. Though it might become off-putting for folks with trypophobia.
The logo should feature an Octopus that is not scary and possibly without any suckers ( Circular bowl-like features present in limbs of the Octopus)

For folks who may have skimmed over the earlier discussion, the octopus idea comes from the octupus emoji that can hold up other emojis. The reference is kind of an inside joke that doesn't necessarily translate to a logo, and we originally brought it up in the context of having it on t-shirts that we wear to conferences like PyCon, where it's a bit easier to tell people the story.


For a more permanent logo, I'd want something that suggests simplicity/efficiency/utility without being overly minimalistic.
@Steve Howell you have way too many requirements for a poor logo. It would be hard to convey any of the three, not to say all of them.
All it has to do is be more consistent - name, color, logo. And use the same all the time. Then we can 'embed' the meaning.
I really only have one requirement--it needs to be on the right place in the spectrum being being too spartan and too ornate.

Like: zulip, purple, tulip pic. Or zulip, blue, octopus pic. etc. Currently it is total chaos - different 'zulip' texts use whatever font anyone decides. My rather cool t-shirt has a lower case text, while the app itself has upper case text. Not sure if the font is the same even. We have several variants of the 'Z' and several variations of green.

IMHO in order of importance:

  • should be distinct
  • if possible shoud convey 'chat' (anything esle is likely too much)
  • should be as simple as possible, while still being distinct and meaningful
  • should be used from now on, and no variations should be acceptable
  • if possible, should not be ugly but nice (last of importance)
Unfortunately, the only thing that conveys 'chat' is the chat bubble and because of that, it is completely over-used.
So a chat bubble scores very high in 'meaning' and very low in 'distinctiveness'.
'Z in a circle' scores low in 'meaning' and low in 'distinctiveness' etc.

Here's an idea:

logo.png
Since the main feature that distinguishes us from other chat applications is our awesome threading model I designed a logo to reflect that. What do you folks think?focused.png
This is my first time trying to design a logo using GIMP. I used this image for designing the logo.
It looks aesthetically nice
However, I feel like it kinda looks like Slack's logo
Another logo idea:

Adding to the design principles that @Boris Yankov listed, here's another to potentially consider:

1. A monochromatic or max, trichromatic design with simple geometry(such that it can be expressed as an svg efficiently).
2. A set of well defined color schemes for general use of the logo.

Now, since the logo is mono/di/tri chromatic, it can be printed/used on any media and on any background colors.

SVG(or rather, simple geometric shape) advantage: we can create animated version of the logo (example: transitions in Google Now App).

Limited color advantage: can be made to match the theme of other eleents depending on use (example: Microsoft Windows logo. The one they made for Win 8 onwards). They use it in blue on white background and white on other colors in other backgrounds.
Also, 3. Ideally, it might help if it is easy to replicate the logo recognizably by hand in a matter of seconds. Though, this point can be ignored.

zulip-logo-draft.jpg
BTW, here's a draft I thought of. I've tried to keep the chat bubble theme, but without the bubbles and by attempting to display how many apps show a "typing..." animation.

You could the dots under "Zulip" and have the second dot nudge up the text similar to how the arrow in Amazon's logo nudges up the "z".

http://fontmeme.com/images/Amazon-Logo.jpg

Yeah, the 'u' could be nudged up here and it'd look nice.
I'm not a designer and I made this in MS Paint like software, :P so... Well, I'll try to do that but I'm ill suited here.
zulip-logo-draft-2.jpg
@Rohitt Vashishtha i like your idea a lot! i remade yours in a non-MS Paint-like software, is this the idea you had in mind? logoedit.png

additionally, i made this minimal version for the logo. i think it represents connections/streams quite well-- would appreciate feedback :)
Screen-Shot-2017-05-30-at-16.02.20.png
The curvy design reminds me of comic sans :simple_smile:
wanted to make it quite curvy as it makes it less, "scary inaccessible tech company" :laughing:
good point
@Vaida Plankyte yes! That's precisely what I was trying. Thanks! :D
i like it a lot! it's dynamic but also the letters seem to fit in the right slots with the o O o o :)
Somehow, it gives friendly vibes in the sea-green color. So, that's plus.
@Rishi Gupta @Tim Abbott do we have a high-res source for the Zulip logo/icon?

For Android we are using the same logo as we use on the web, but for iOS we use this:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/blob/master/ios/ZulipMobile/Images.xcassets/AppIcon.appiconset/zulip-1024.png
It has a different hue. To be consistent we need to recreate the logos from the same source. Ideally something larger than 1024x1024.

@Boris Yankov We have the logo in 512*512 -
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/images/logo/zulip-icon-512x512.png
A friend of mine created the same in 1024*1012
Zulip-logo-1024.png
Zulip-logo-1024_svg.svg
@Akash Nimare thanks. Especially for the svg file. Where did it came from?
I remember @Alicja Raszkowska doing something. Here it is!
I created the basic layout in sketch and a friend, took care of the colors then exported to svg, png. I have the sketch file if anyone needs it. Zulip-logo.sketch
Is the logo we are using currently derived from this file?
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/images/logo/zulip-icon-512x512.png this image doesn’t load for me on iOS ... strange

Is the logo we are using currently derived from this file?

I took this file as a base and try to recreated the same in 1024*1024.
Because the icon has some subtle gradient, basically unnoticable with human eye ;)
Yup, it's hard to spot though :wink:
Is the png file not loading for anyone else on the latest iOS beta?

@Akash Nimare the gradient is not in the Sketch file :slight_smile:
I am trying to resolve an inconsistency with icons, so trying to be as consistent as possible.
@Armaan Ahluwalia do you mean when zoomed in?
@Boris Yankov when I click the image. The svg loads fine in the lightbox but the png doesn’t

It is a known issue... but you have a good point.
The default browser viewer is actually not bad. If we stop using the Lightbox for our png file, we would solve the issue.
Actually, I am not sure it is the same issue I am referring to. Some of the images that I would expect to load do not. I'll investigate.
Thanks. It’s not all pngs just some. Sorry for hijacking thread.

@Akash Nimare Thanks for these!

There seems to be a subtle difference in the colors -- comparing the images in your first messages a couple of hours ago:

  • zulip-icon-512x512.png from the repo, vs.
  • the Zulip-logo-1024.png that you sent

the background on the second one looks a bit lighter and greener to me. (On my desktop's monitor.)
Ultimately, I am not surprised. The gradient we currently have in the circle seems a bit random to me, if it can not be seen.
We either need to find the original source file, or recreate the icons we use from one of the 'close enough' new ones.
I am surprised at the amount of different 'logos' we have.

@Allen Rabinovich :wave: ! We're looking for a vector version, or very-high-res version, of the Zulip logo in order to generate versions of it for new sizes and formats.

From the zulip.git history, I think you designed the current logo in 2013. I see a 512px PNG in the repo, as well as lower-res versions. Do you know where we might find the source file, or a higher-resolution or SVG image?
Perhaps Allen will see a notification for that and come help us out. :smile:
For context, we definitely need at least 1024x1024, if it is png. Obviously vector is better.

There might be some glitches after exporting it to png but the background color should be exactly same as the original one since I picked it using the color picker. Do you see the same difference in svg file also? Sketch sometimes do some odd changes after exporting the file.
pasted image

Here is a funny logo:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/assets/bad-logo.png
'bad logo' :slight_smile:
I'm not sure about everyone else but now that I look at this on desktop I see a difference in gradient inside the "Z" too between the svg akash added and the original.
That is also not our logo :slight_smile:
We should get them out of zulip/zulip

That is close, but I would argue not our logo:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/assets/emails/logo.svg

I also see an inconsitent in the height of top and bottom section of Z (not sure if it's intentional)
logo_design.jpg
@Rishi Gupta I think we want a /press page that is as simple as containing the logo versions and whatever esle might be useful when covering the project in a media
We also need a solid background version for icons for the new Androids (could be several shapes, not only circle) and iOS
(Brand guidelines for the inspiration - https://brandfolder.com/slack)

The black zulip I think is the text version of our logo? In any case it is what we use on all our print marketing.
Agreed about a press page.
The black one is lower case. It is not what we use in the app.

It is important to have a consistent and very restrictive set of colors and styles when related to branding.
Only one text variant, only one color variation, and one monochromatic (black/white) should exist.
The one in the upper left of the app is I think because we didn't have the functionality to add a real logo (though there is an open PR for it).

@Akash Nimare

There might be some glitches after exporting it to png but the background color should be exactly same as the original one since I picked it using the color picker.

Hmm. Looking closer, and with both images on my screen at a larger size, it is pretty subtle. I'll check the SVG too.

Here's a difference that is actually pretty conspicuous when I look at them full size: your newer version has less "shine" on the Z -- the gradient doesn't get as bright.

Anyway, like Boris has said in this thread: we should have (for each basic variation, like color / monochrome) one consistent logo, with a source file that all the PNGs etc. we use are generated from :)
(And yep, same color difference comparing Zulip_1024_svg.svg from early in this thread vs. zulip-icon-512x512.png in the repo.)

Aha, @Akash Nimare I see what happened with the colors -- it's that background gradient that @Boris Yankov mentioned.

The SVG's background is uniform, and it matches the right-hand edge of the original PNG's background. But the original PNG's background varies... and in fact that is the lightest and greenest part of it.
contrast.png
This is the logo with high contrast applied to it. There is a gradient.

@Greg Price -- sorry I didn't reply right away, been traveling for a bit. Here are the vector assets for the logo: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/w1l79f81ipnaefe/AADE8_AvEvLprWyR01DjdDEia?dl=0

Zulip Logos
(And let's talk about that folder name / icon alignment ;))

Cool, I think the next step is for someone to check those into the codebase.

(Also, someone should open an issue about the styling for Dropbox links, since that looks like the alignment is broken)
submitted #10580 :+1:

Thanks @Allen Rabinovich ! These will be helpful.

There's one major element of the logo we've been using that isn't in these: the background field. It wouldn't be hard to take one of these and slap a light blue-green disk behind it... but the background also features a subtle color gradient, which would take more skill to match.

Would you rummage a bit more and see if you might have additional source/vector assets lying around somewhere, which might include the background?

There are also a couple of other differences between these and the logos we've been using:

  • The ends and creases in the Z ribbon are rounded here; they're straight in the current logo.
  • I think these have more "shine" than the current logo, i.e. the bright areas of the Z are brighter.

I don't have a strong preference between these and the current logo in those respects, though.
@Greg Price @Tim Abbott @Rishi Gupta the logo we are using does not match the files in Dropbox. Not sure how we reached the currently used logo in the top left of the web app.
I went ahead and edited the file that @Akash Nimare did in Sketch and very precisely replicated the gradients both on the background and the elements of the 'Z' itself

@Rishi Gupta we can keep any graphics sources either in the zulip/zulip or even a separate project. For example, we want to have very high rez for press use, and Illustrator / Sketch source files too.

The text part of the logo in the upper left of the web app should be ignored. The reason it's there is we haven't yet added the feature that would allow us to add a logo of the proper dimensions in that space.
I fiddled with inkscape at some point to try to recreate an svg of the logo from a png that I had; it's possible the z-in-a-circle currently in the upper left is the output of that process.
agreed that we should keep the correct versions of the logo in zulip/zulip and also have a press page for it

I went ahead and edited the file that @Akash Nimare did in Sketch and very precisely replicated the gradients both on the background and the elements of the 'Z' itself

@Boris Yankov, could you post or send me a copy of this?

There's an open mobile issue from 2018 (#M2763); I'll paste the full text here for convenience:

Hi, my name is Valeria. I'm a graphic designer and I'd like to collaborate on your open source project and propose free logo/icon design for your app. If it's something you're interested in, please, let me know!
Best,
Valeria

It may be that we're not interested, and we can shorten the long Zulip mobile issues list by one. :slight_smile: In case we're interested, though, here's a hastily-assembled list of issues that seem to involve the Zulip logo. The list will also be more broadly useful for people who've noticed glitches or things they wish were different about our use of the logo.

Web:
#13906 "Provide Zulip artwork with public copyright and trademark."

Mobile:
#M3571 "Check how Android launchers that prefer square icons handle ours"
#M438 "Add unread messages badge on app icon"
#M2756 "The app needs a splash screen"

Desktop:
#D787 "macOS dock icon is too large"
#D250 "Tray icon should probably include Zulip logo even with unread messages"
#D620 "System tray icon ugly in KDE Plasma"
#D445 "Change icon on mention"

@Tim Abbott

@Chris Bobbe obviously there's places where someone who can do good design work would be helpful, but issues like #11752 I think are unrelated as they're purely engineering tasks to support uploading (etc.) custom favicons.

issues like #11752 I think are unrelated as they're purely engineering tasks to support uploading (etc.) custom favicons.

You're right; there's definitely noise in that list of issues (I just removed #11752) and I haven't read them all. I didn't want to spend too much time composing it in case we weren't interested, but perhaps the noise can be ignored, and the list can inform a decision on the specific question of a new logo design proposal.
My own opinion is that the current logo is fine, and I'd like to close stale issues, but I'm happy to leave this one open if you'd like.

@Chris Bobbe I'd go ahead and close that issue; I don't think think it's super actionable. You can ask if the person is still interested in helping with design work; if they are, there's other things that are higher-value they could work on.
(aside, I promise I'll get PR #1254 mergeable for #11752 once I get time :sob:)
Just posted here, here, and here with a few things from my list above; hopefully that's a bit useful since we've just gotten a new logo!
